title: @Ironstylus regarding Caitlyn VU
body:
Any plans on Cait? I mean the hat is awesome of course but besides that her visuals seem to portray her as the exact opposite of the kind of women her attitude and overall feel suggests.

I mean sure its visually appealing for those who enjoy sexy women, but it just seems like fanservice at best. Not saying this kind of look is bad, but it just doesnt mesh as well as it could with Caitlyns persona. With elise id say the sexual look does work well because she is supposed to be seductive in order to lure men into her traps, but i doubt Cait uses her miniskirt in her investigations. Just my thoughts on the matter

replies.body:
Saved me the trouble of making it. If parrot doesn't reply, I'm going to be pissed.

My thoughts are generally along the lines of http://xelandra.deviantart.com/art/LoL-Caitlyn-Redesign-391316429, but the hat and current weapon, stupid as they are, are non-negotiable. I still miss Karma's fans, I will not lose Cait's hat.

There's a lot of stuff going on here that I like, I'll expand more on about it when I get back.

EDIT: Ok, FINALLY WON A GAME. Anywhoozle, yes, I generally like this concept. I think it does some interesting things that preserve what I feel is core to Cait. There's some aristocratic notes, there's some sophistication, and there's class. 

I do feel it might be a bit too Victorian to be uniquely Piltover, whatever that means. That's part of the challenge actually. We've made Jayce and Vi, two people who are supposed to be interacting with Cait and she simply doesn't fit in. They're not really steampunk in thier language, they're sorta.. "manatech". So, while I feel Cait can have Victorian notes, we should find a way to bring her into that manatech (or hextech) area and get her materials, her shapes and other properties in line with Piltover.

Part of that is sort of figuring out what the hell Piltover actually looks like. We have a start with Jayce and Vi, so that's good. We may have to flesh a few more details out before we jump right into Cait. 

Her hat is another thing. Some love it, some hate it. It is indeed iconic. When you think of Cait, or you associate let's say.. cosplaying Cait, you think purple frilly short dress, knee high boots and big Willy Wonka hat. Now, charm is great, but we need to extract what that charm is and see where we can re-channel it. Maybe a bowler hat? Maybe just a smaller version of her current hat? I do love the hat for its charms, but it's sort of silly. 

That said, if we ever, and that's a big if considering our priorities right now, hit Cait with a VU, my gut guess is that we'd do a traditional skin for her. That way i think we can solve some of her thematic issues without destroying the charming thing we've grown to love. 

But yeah. With our priorities now, a Cait VU is probably a long way off, and as per usual, about anything I talk about:

http://imgur.com/8JAJGRg

>They're not really steampunk in thier language, they're sorta.. "manatech"

I saw in Jayce - and a bit less so in Vi - a sort of modern approach to classical art deco illustrations of future technology. I think there's definitely something to be said for that, even if my impressions are off, and would humbly offer [this steampunk ray-gun](http://brassgoggles.co.uk/forum/index.php?topic=10120.0) as a jumping-off point for design motifs for a Caitlyn VU's gun, with a [more modern design a la this concept](http://www.polycount.com/forum/showthread.php?p=1927568).

Oh man, I love that raygun.. 

I'm not sure I'd go with the modern gun thing, there's a lot of bevels on that thing, and though I love bevels, I think it speaks of a more advanced manufacturing technique than Piltover would actually have.

That said, I think you're nail-on-the-head about classical deco with a twist. We take a lot of that sleekness and try to see what it might look at infused with a magic-based power source. There's something that still needs to evoke the familiar, but show that there's some advanced abilities native to the technology and style.

I was more focused on the profile silhouette of the sniper rifle, since I agree that the bevels are a bit much (especially compared to Vi's gauntlets - very flat surfaces). Taking the idea of the modern sniper rifle and giving it some of the sleekness of the ray gun would be like putty in your hands (and longshot - what if Caitlyn's rifle *was* a ray rifle? ...On second thought, maybe not).

And art deco seems to be a recurring theme throughout Runeterra, I made [a thread of various ravings on the topic](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3890839) a while ago and it's something I'd love to dig into further if I was any good at sketching.

That's a cool thread, I'll have to flip through it.

And yeah, I see what you mean about the silhouette, though I think the gun would still have to feel sorta hand-crafted, and I'd prefer it to be a projectile base weapon, not an energy one.
Nah, skins aren't canon.
Silly is good! I like silly. If you don't have silly, than you change charming, pun-loving Trundle for boring, angry Trundle. And that's no fun.

Honestly....I kind of like this. Though the cape is extremely reminiscent of {{champion:67}} .
Also, The mini skirt has always kind of been Caits thing. Maybe if they made it less frilly, but kept the overall design of her current outfit, it'd look a bit better.
The hair in this model is a definite upgrade, though.

Yeah, as I said, some sort of compromise would have to be made with the hat, at least for what a new base would be in my mind. She would still have to HAVE a hat, because she has one in every skin, and that's a main read of hers. It just depends on how we figure out how to balance that read with what thematically fits with the character. 

I mean, maybe we give it some cool crazy purpose. Not Inspector Gadget-y, but maybe it has some sort of function.

Or at the very least, we take a nice look into women's high fashion and find a way to make something as absurd as that hat into something cool and fashionable.
Maybe have a little scope in the hat that slides down whenever she ults! That'd match up her visuals with her gameplay.
I really like this idea.

Oh wow, this is actually really cool and answers my "What would a visual update look like?" question.

I absolutely agree though, if Riot takes away Caitlyn's hat, I'm boycotting them.

The artist has another picture with the hat:

[(http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/attachment.php?attachmentid=751291&d=1375847289)]
Also id just like to say, as much as i dont like the reddit style on this site, it seems kind of stupid for the community to refuse to use it and lose out on conversations like this

As I've said, it takes getting used to. Features are in the works that will hopefully make it more palatable. However, for a good case study, go back to that original thread and see the nightmare it's become simply because I asked for a change of venue for various reasons. 

Meanwhile, here we are, actually talking about the subject :P

...Because you wouldn't let us talk about this subject unless we had it over here.

I agree that most of the posts over there are a bit harsh and are way too accusatory, but it's not really their fault considering the thread wouldn't be the way it was over there if you had just replied in accordance to the OP instead of telling them to make the thread over here.

I like you, parrot, but please don't make GD look worse than it is because you don't like it.

They're not a "bit harsh", they're toxic, no question. Sorry. You're not going to convince me otherwise. 

Additionally, the way this conversation needs to go, at least the way I can track it best to actually act on the feedback, is to see it in this format. In the future, this is where I'm going to be setting up shop for Relaunch discussions, that's kind of just the way it is out of necessity if players actually want me to see and be able to incorporate the feedback. I asked a polite favor and things over there exploded. But here we are, on topic over here, and it's a nightmare over there where reading those posts just makes me feel like crap. 

Sorry, I have enough to deal with in my life. I don't have the energy to deal with that much of a tantrum.

Tbh I think a lot of that toxicity is going to come over to these forums once they're forced to change and I would imagine a lot of that toxicity will be upvoted so you're not going to be able to skip it like you seem to think.

Over there, ALL of the toxicity was upvoted. Even if somebody toxic is upvoted because they made a snarky comment that somebody agreed with, it's not going to have the same effect or be in the same great numbers as over there. It will be overall less visible, and poor parrot won't have to deal with as many douchebags over here, even if some slip through.

1.  I like her outfit in general
2.  I like the belts on her leg
3.  There's room for improvement on the gun
4.  I'm not a fan of hats and TBH, something like that which you can add on, shouldn't be a part of her base model.  Can we get a hat toggle?
5.  Her hair needs a new look.  I like it long like that, but the styling needs changed.  Her outfit is begging for either pigtails or corkscrews, but I think either would be wrong for her (pigtails are the better option)
6.  Keep the boots and the fingerless gloves.
7.  I love her current breast size/figure as is.  Don't change a thing.

In addition to a VU, she also needs a cyberpunk style skin that we can buy to go with her rework.  Something from GITS or whatever.

"Everybody wishes they had as cool a hat as Caitlyn"  
  
The hat is an essential part of her silhouette and needs to stay.  
It's also one of her trademark features.  
  
The gun does look rather weird, though.

Hat toggle at least.

Most other games have them.

Yeah, games in which you can customize or choose your character's headgear.  
  
League is not such a game.

I think that Caitlyn needs to fit her lore a bit better too, but I'm having a hard time imagining what that would look like. She's the Sheriff of Piltover, obviously, but she already has a Sheriff Caitlyn skin and an Officer Caitlyn skin. So how do you update her classic skin to fit her lore, without stepping on those other skins?

This is a biggie. In the case of Caitlyn I see her almost like.. a "thematic VU", where we address how she fits into the world. I think one of the big things we can do is leave plenty of space for officer Caitlyn, as it's a contemporary skin, yet diverge enough from the base to give her a classic skin if we were to at all reapproach her. Again, I'll get into more detail when I return.

If you try to change where she fits in the world thematically, is that something that can cascade over to the other technological/piltover champs?  I mean do you bring her in line with Vi/Jinx or since she's not from a criminal background, does she need her own thematics.  

Can't a big city have several competing fashions and styles?

I think it's essential that she has a different fashion or style. I think, out of all of them, (Jayce, Jinx, Vi) Cait is the most fashionable. To me there's something sorta Sherlock and Watson going on with Cait and Vi. Vi can be punky, disheveled, whatever, but Cait has this contrast of being highly fashionable, maybe to a fault. She's proper and she's a sniper. A fashion-centric lady sniper is a pretty damn cool concept. I'd like to see where we can push that to. 

I think right now she's just confusing. There's no intent for her to be of any contrast, it just happens to be so. If we go back in, sew in that intent, we can make something that simultaneously stands out, but also fits into the world. 

Indeed, she doesn't come from a criminal background, so she has no reason to be in line with Jinx or Vi in mimicking fashion style, but she is part of an established police force. They must have some code of dress. Even if she's in a uniform, who knows. 

That's why I do like the Lady Mechanika stuff because there's some feelings of uniform, but also a lot of style. There's also sophistication but some practicality, all be it with a lot of flair.

Honestly Lady Mechanika is all I can see for a Caitlyn VU now, I mean this is exactly how I imagine her looking, the purple, the hat and the belts. I really like the Idea of belted sleeves and a high collar for Caitlyn.
[(http://www.joebenitez.com/images/mechanika/lm0bFULL.jpg)]

Steampunk sucks and isn't cool.

Don't do it.
But... Caitlyn is *already* steampunk.
I do not want her to be made more steampunk/have a as big a change as Sejuanni.
But Sejuani's old outfit looked ridiculous in a bad way. She was a battle hardened tough as nails warrior. Why was she riding on a boar in a bikini?

Because Cait is pretty unique looking. Parrot is a nerd who likes steampunk and wants to make Cait look like Lady Mechanica or something.

I feel it will make Cait too different and just be some lame steampunk girl Parrot wanted to shoehorn into the game they work on because she likes weird stuff like that. 

I don't want another Quinn.

You...do notice how he's posting with 'we don't want to make her generic steampunk', right? Also, IronStylus is a dude.

And what's wrong with Quinn? Visually, I mean, she's a bit of a mess gameplay wise.

Not sure why he said "we." It is their idea it seems.

http://gyazo.com/90a3fcdb8c05b33cbe9181b76f5ad4f1

I don't trust Parrot with these things.

(Quinn is a very plain, boring champion to look at and was designed by parrot who has a passion for very clothed females because it makes them "strong" or something stupid like that.)

Dressing her up as a bird themed stripper does not magically make her visually interesting.

Even exiting the realms of hyperbole, a female can be fully clothed and visually interesting; see Leona.

I suppose I see your view, but you don't need to look out there in order to look cool.

Bump for answers.
This better be worth it, Parrot.
It shall be. Once I get out of these games I'm playing :P

Wonderful, thanks for the update. 
I'm already feeling better.
I need to win at least ONE NORMAL SR tonight. THAT'S ALL. Sorry it's taking so long >:|

It's okay, the promise of return is enough.
GL;HF
The Feathered One has spoken, dont put away the bird seeds yet men, he might forget to post otherwise

Why wouldn't it be worth it, assuming you actually WANT a discussion on the subject?  
  
You wanted a discussion, the Parrot told you to go here to do it, since GD is just a bundle of self-entitled twats who insult everything and everyone, no matter if it's justified or not (case in point: blaming IronStylus for bad forum moderation...like, what?)

Because after causing a serious uproar in the GD thread with repeated replies to post here, if we get absolutely no answer, or a "we're working on a few ideas. Get back to you at a future date" kind of answer, I'll be kind of miffed.
Why go through all of that effort to have us relocate here if nothing of value will be discussed? 
This thread was made 15 minutes ago. Assuming IronStylus has been at least semi paying attention to us, he's had to of seen this.

I think you should keep the dress short in the front (maybe a tiny bit longer) and then make the back longer (like to the knees). Give the front of the dress a deep V but then keep the belt under the bust (Perhaps add some gold etching to it) so that the V extends below the belt. Kind of do a sweet heart neckline but extend it under the arm and have it connect in the middle of the upper arm with a cog button. The shoulder should be bare except for the existing brown strap that goes under the arm as well. 

Get rid of the silly collar thing. Add some purple and ruffles to the gloves. I like her boots but you should make the gold part of her hat match the gold of the boots or vice versa. 

I feel like she should be carrying some special rounds for her headshots and ultimates that could be attached to the belts on her legs. As for adding Piltover technology, you should make the etchings more consistent and perhaps that teal glowing substance like Jayce. OR make it purple for her. Her gun should have more gold embellishments to match also with that magic substance. The purple needs to be toned down and needs an added texture. I was thinking like a design with subtle stripes. 

If I had time to draw I would!

I really just want Cait to feel a little more tactical. When it boils down to who Cait is -- she is a law enforcement sniper.  And the "sniper" bit only shows through her ult and AA range.  The thematic falls short, and nothing else in her kit or appearance does any justice to fulfilling the Sniper archetype that I feel players want to associate with.

As far as piltover is concerned, Cait is horribly outdated fashionably.  For the record, I hate the hat, and think she'd be a stronger character without it, with an emphasis again on the sniper rifle -- which is the real reason to play Cait or associate with Cait.  She can be fashionable, but the hat is really limiting.  She definitely needs to drop the hat, get dressed to be Vi's partner, and bring a new rifle to the fields of justice.
